title: Pedro Pascal
content:
{{short description|Chilean and American actor (born 1975)}} {{for|people with a similar name|Pedro Pascual (disambiguation)}} {{pp-semi-indef|small=yes}} {{family name hatnote|Balmaceda|Pascal|lang=Spanish}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2023}} {{Use American English|date=July 2023}} {{Infobox person | name = Pedro Pascal | image = Pedro Pascal by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Pascal in July 2017 | birth_name = José Pedro Balmaceda Pascal | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|4|2}} | birth_place = [[Santiago]], Chile | other_names = Pedro Balmaceda
Alexander Pascal | occupation = Actor | education = [[New York University]] ([[Bachelor of Fine Arts|BFA]]) | years_active = 1996–present | relatives = [[Lux Pascal]] (sister) | signature = Pedro Pascal Signature.svg }} '''José Pedro Balmaceda Pascal''' ({{IPA-es|xoˈse ˈpeðɾo βalmaˈseða pasˈkal}}; born April 2, 1975) is a Chilean and American actor. After nearly two decades of taking small roles in film and television, Pascal rose to prominence for portraying [[Oberyn Martell]] in the [[Game of Thrones (season 4)|fourth season]] of the [[HBO]] fantasy series ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' (2014) and [[Javier Peña]] in the [[Netflix]] crime series ''[[Narcos]]'' (2015–2017). He went on to appear in the films ''[[The Great Wall (film)|The Great Wall]]'' (2016), ''[[Kingsman: The Golden Circle]]'' (2017), ''[[The Equalizer 2]]'' (2018), ''[[Triple Frontier (film)|Triple Frontier]]'' (2019), ''[[Wonder Woman 1984]]'' (2020), and ''[[The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent]]'' (2022). Since 2019, Pascal has starred as [[The Mandalorian (character)|the title character]] in the [[Disney+]] ''[[Star Wars]]'' series ''[[The Mandalorian]]'' and again in ''[[The Book of Boba Fett]]'' (2022). Since 2023, he has played [[Joel (The Last of Us)|Joel Miller]] in the HBO drama series ''[[The Last of Us (TV series)|The Last of Us]]'', for which he received nominations for a [[Primetime Emmy Award]] and a [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Award]].{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2023/tv/news/2023-emmy-nominations-list-1235666521/ |title=Emmys 2023: The Complete Nominations List |work=Variety |date=July 12, 2023 |access-date=July 12, 2023 |archive-date=July 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230717073813/https://variety.com/2023/tv/news/2023-emmy-nominations-list-1235666521/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |last=Shanfeld |first=Ethan |date=2023-12-11 |title=Golden Globes 2024: Full Nominations List (Updating Live) |url=https://variety.com/2023/film/news/golden-globes-nominations-list-nominees-2024-1235831576/ |access-date=2023-12-11 |website=Variety |language=en-US}} ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine named him one of the [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]] in 2023.{{cite news |url=https://time.com/collection/100-most-influential-people-2023/ |title=Time 100 |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=April 13, 2023 |access-date=April 13, 2023 |archive-date=April 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230413151502/https://time.com/collection/100-most-influential-people-2023/ |url-status=live }} ==Early life== {{see also|Allende family|Balmaceda family}} José Pedro Balmaceda Pascal was born on April 2, 1975, in [[Santiago]], [[Chile]]{{Cite web |title=Pedro Pascal Profile |website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/pedro_pascal |access-date= April 2, 2022 |agency=Rotten Tomatoes|archive-date= April 2, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220402214627/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/pedro_pascal |url-status=live }} to child psychologist Verónica Pascal Ureta and fertility doctor José Balmaceda Riera.{{cite news |last=Ito |first=Robert |title=A Lethal Prince, Even if a Bit Clumsy: Pedro Pascal Becomes Red Viper on 'Game of Thrones' |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/30/arts/television/pedro-pascal-becomes-red-viper-on-game-of-thrones.html?_r=0 |access-date= May 27, 2014 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date= March 28, 2014 |archive-date= November 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201112020115/http://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/30/arts/television/pedro-pascal-becomes-red-viper-on-game-of-thrones.html?_r=0 |url-status=live}}{{cite web |last=Koblin |first=John |title=Pedro Pascal: Making It at 41 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/03/fashion/mens-style/pedro-pascal-great-wall-game-of-thrones-narcos-late-success.html |access-date= July 4, 2019 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date= February 3, 2017 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040531/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/03/fashion/mens-style/pedro-pascal-great-wall-game-of-thrones-narcos-late-success.html |url-status=live}} His paternal grandmother was born in [[Palma de Mallorca]], [[Spain]].{{Cite web |last=Palma |first=Redacción |date=2017-09-21 |title=El pasado mallorquín del agente Peña de Narcos |url=https://www.diariodemallorca.es/sociedad/2017/09/21/pasado-mallorquin-agente-pena-narcos-3343743.html |access-date=2023-05-30 |website=Diario de Mallorca |language=es |archive-date=May 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230530210555/https://www.diariodemallorca.es/sociedad/2017/09/21/pasado-mallorquin-agente-pena-narcos-3343743.html |url-status=live }} He has an older sister named Javiera,{{cite web |title="Narcos" star Pedro Pascal on the mystery of Pablo Escobar's death | via=[[YouTube]] |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HC5G0bsSQtw |access-date= November 3, 2020 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040511/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HC5G0bsSQtw |url-status=live}} a younger brother named Nicolás,{{Cite web |last=Pascal |first=Pedro |date=April 10, 2019 |title=This is my brother, Nicolas. |url=https://www.instagram.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fp%2FBwE8pfHDb4Y%2F%3Fhl%3Den |access-date=2023-07-09 |website=www.instagram.com}} and a younger sister named [[Lux Pascal|Lux]], who is an actress and [[transgender]] activist.{{cite web |url=http://www.t13.cl/noticia/entretencion/Lucas-Balmaceda-el-hermano-del-chileno-de-Game-of-Thrones-que-llego-a-remecer-Los-80 |title=Lucas Balmaceda, el hermano del chileno de Game of Thrones que llegó a remecer Los 80 |website=t13.cl |access-date= January 13, 2018 |archive-date= November 11, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201111204523/https://www.t13.cl/noticia/entretencion/Lucas-Balmaceda-el-hermano-del-chileno-de-Game-of-Thrones-que-llego-a-remecer-Los-80 |url-status=live}}{{cite web |title=Pedro Pascal Sweetly Supports His Sister Lux After She Comes Out as a Trans Woman: 'Mi Corazón' |url=https://people.com/movies/pedro-pascal-supports-sister-lux-comes-out-trans-woman/ |website=People |date= February 9, 2021 |access-date= February 12, 2021 |archive-date= February 11, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210211212045/https://people.com/movies/pedro-pascal-supports-sister-lux-comes-out-trans-woman/ |url-status=live }} Pascal's mother was the cousin of [[Andrés Pascal Allende]], the nephew of socialist [[President of Chile|Chilean President]] [[Salvador Allende]] (through his sister [[Laura Allende|Laura]]). Pascal Allende was an early leader of the [[Revolutionary Left Movement (Chile)|Movement of the Revolutionary Left]], a militant [[far-left]] organization.{{Cite web |url=https://www.latercera.com/noticia/pedro-pascal-punto/ |title=Pedro Pascal, en su punto |website=La Tercera |date= September 1, 2017 |access-date= January 10, 2021 |archive-date= February 24, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210224073623/https://www.latercera.com/noticia/pedro-pascal-punto/ |url-status=live }} Nine months after his birth, his family sought refuge in the [[Venezuela]]n embassy in Santiago, and later received political asylum in [[Denmark]].{{cite news |last=Broeske |first=Pat H. |title=The Viper Prince |url=http://www.orangecoast.com/features/2014/04/28/the-viper-prince |access-date= May 27, 2014 |publisher=Orange Coast |date= April 28, 2014 |archive-date= June 2, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140602035249/http://www.orangecoast.com/features/2014/04/28/the-viper-prince |url-status=live}} Ultimately, the family moved to the United States, where Pascal was raised in [[San Antonio, Texas]],{{cite news |last=McIntyre |first=Gina |title='Game of Thrones': Red Viper actor Pedro Pascal hates spoilers too |url=http://herocomplex.latimes.com/tv/game-of-thrones-red-viper-actor-pedro-pascal-hates-spoilers-too/ |access-date= May 27, 2014 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date= May 12, 2014 |archive-date= September 8, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180908015642/https://herocomplex.latimes.com/tv/game-of-thrones-red-viper-actor-pedro-pascal-hates-spoilers-too/ }} until they relocated to [[Orange County, California]], when he was 11 years old. By the time he was eight years old, his family regularly visited Chile to see his 34 cousins.{{cite magazine |last=Vary |first=Adam B. |title=Pedro Pascal on Fame and 'The Mandalorian': 'Can We Cut the S— and Talk About the Child?' |url=https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/pedro-pascal-the-mandalorian-star-wars-wonder-woman-1984-1234803468/ |access-date= January 1, 2021 |magazine=Variety |date= October 14, 2020 |archive-date= October 15, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201015194622/https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/pedro-pascal-the-mandalorian-star-wars-wonder-woman-1984-1234803468/ |url-status=live }} He pursued acting at the [[Orange County School of the Arts]] and graduated in 1993, before attending [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]], where he graduated in 1997.{{cite web |title=ETW Alumni |url=https://tisch.nyu.edu/drama/about/studios/experimental-theatre-wing/alumni |website=[[New York University]] |access-date= January 1, 2021 |archive-date= January 19, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210119205137/https://tisch.nyu.edu/drama/about/studios/experimental-theatre-wing/alumni |url-status=live }} In 1995, his father was indicted by a federal grand jury for his involvement in events at a fertility clinic he ran with two others.{{cite news |last1=Sims |first1=Calvin |title=Fertility Clinics in Chile: A Tale of a Doctor Fleeing U.S. Law |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/04/26/world/fertility-clinics-in-chile-a-tale-of-a-doctor-fleeing-us-law.html |agency=nytimes.com |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date= April 26, 1996 |access-date= February 12, 2021 |archive-date= January 5, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210105191300/https://www.nytimes.com/1996/04/26/world/fertility-clinics-in-chile-a-tale-of-a-doctor-fleeing-us-law.html |url-status=live }} Following this, Pascal's parents and two youngest siblings returned to Chile. Pascal maintains that his father did nothing wrong.{{Cite news |last=Koblin |first=John |date= February 3, 2017 |title=Pedro Pascal: Making It at 41 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/03/fashion/mens-style/pedro-pascal-great-wall-game-of-thrones-narcos-late-success.html |access-date= May 17, 2022 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040531/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/03/fashion/mens-style/pedro-pascal-great-wall-game-of-thrones-narcos-late-success.html |url-status=live }}{{Cite news |last=Farinh |first=Ricardo |date= October 2, 2020 |title=De refugiado a estrela da televisão: a jornada de Pedro Pascal para chegar a Hollywood |work=NiT |url=https://www.nit.pt/cultura/de-refugiado-estrela-da-televisao-jornada-de-pedro-pascal-para-chegar-hollywood |access-date= May 17, 2022 |archive-date= July 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220720034740/https://www.nit.pt/cultura/de-refugiado-estrela-da-televisao-jornada-de-pedro-pascal-para-chegar-hollywood |url-status=live }} His mother died by suicide in 1999.{{Cite web |last=Gilson |first=Hilary |date= June 15, 2010 |title=José Pedro Balmaceda (1948- ) |url=https://embryo.asu.edu/pages/jose-pedro-balmaceda-1948 |access-date= May 4, 2022 |archive-date= April 19, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220419155718/https://embryo.asu.edu/pages/jose-pedro-balmaceda-1948 |url-status=live }} After her death, he began using her surname professionally as a tribute to her and because he felt that Americans had difficulty pronouncing his original surname, Balmaceda.{{cite web |title=The Mandalorian's Pedro Pascal Credits His Success to His Mom, Who Died Before He Became Famous |url=https://people.com/tv/the-mandalorian-pedro-pascal-credits-his-success-to-his-mom/ |date= November 13, 2020 |access-date= January 1, 2021 |website=People |archive-date= December 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201212035519/https://people.com/tv/the-mandalorian-pedro-pascal-credits-his-success-to-his-mom/ |url-status=live }} == Career == === 1999–2013: Early work === Pascal has appeared in several television series, including ''[[Buffy the Vampire Slayer]]'', ''[[The Good Wife]]'', ''[[Homeland (TV series)|Homeland]]'', ''[[The Mentalist]]'', ''[[Law & Order: Criminal Intent]], [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]],'' and ''[[Graceland (TV series)|Graceland]]''.{{cite news |title=''The Good Wife'' Actor Checks Into USA's ''Graceland'' in Major Arc |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/graceland-pedro-pascal-joins-386618 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |last=Ng |first=Philiana |access-date= May 30, 2013 |date= November 5, 2012 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040507/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/graceland-pedro-pascal-joins-386618 |url-status=live}} He was cast in the pilot for the [[Wonder Woman (2011 TV pilot)|2011 ''Wonder Woman'' television adaptation]],{{Cite web |last=Guthrie |first=Marisa |date= March 3, 2011 |title=Pedro Pascal Joins NBC's 'Wonder Woman' Pilot |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/pedro-pascal-joins-nbcs-wonder-164014/ |access-date= July 18, 2021 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |language=en-US |archive-date= July 18, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210718145651/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/pedro-pascal-joins-nbcs-wonder-164014/ |url-status=live }} but the show was not picked up. [[File:Pedro Pascal SDCC 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|Pascal at the 2014 [[San Diego Comic Con]]]] Pascal has extensive stage experience as both an actor and director; he received the Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award and [[Back Stage Garland Awards|Garland Award]] for his role in the [[International City Theater]] production of ''Orphans'', and has performed in classical and contemporary works. In 2010, he wrote a play, directed by [[Sarah Silverman]], ''Flaca Loves Bone'', about four siblings who meet in a snowy wood to uncover a family secret.{{Cite web |title=Pedro Pascal |url=https://www.doollee.com/PlaywrightsP/pascal-pedro.php |access-date= February 26, 2023 |website=www.doollee.com |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221210015015/https://www.doollee.com/PlaywrightsP/pascal-pedro.php |archive-date= December 10, 2022 |url-status=live}} He made his directorial debut with play ''underneathmybed'' in 2008. He also directed ''Yosemite'' and ''Killing Play'' at [[Rattlestick Playwrights Theater]].{{Cite web |date= December 15, 2011 |title=RATTLESTICK PLAYWRIGHTS THEATER to present World Premiere of "YOSEMITE" by Daniel Talbott |url=https://www.omdkc.com/rattlestick-playwrights-theater-to-present-world-premiere-of-yosemite-by-da/ |access-date= February 26, 2023 |website=DKC/O&M |language=en-US |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171231201948/https://www.omdkc.com/rattlestick-playwrights-theater-to-present-world-premiere-of-yosemite-by-da/ |archive-date= December 31, 2017 |url-status=live}}{{Cite web |author=BWW News Desk |title=Rattlestick Playwrights' underneathmybed Closes 10/10 |url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/off-broadway/article/Rattlestick-Playwrights-underneathmybed-Closes-1010-20101010 |access-date= February 26, 2023 |website=BroadwayWorld.com |language=en |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230226145858/https://www.broadwayworld.com/off-broadway/article/Rattlestick-Playwrights-underneathmybed-Closes-1010-20101010 |archive-date= February 26, 2023 |url-status=live}} He is a member of New York City's [[LAByrinth Theater Company]].{{cite web |title=Company Members |url=http://www.labtheater.org/companymembers/memberslist.html |website=[[LAByrinth Theater Company]] |access-date= June 4, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019045129/http://www.labtheater.org/companymembers/memberslist.html |archive-date= October 19, 2013}} === 2014–2018: Breakthrough === In 2014, Pascal portrayed the character [[Oberyn Martell]] in the [[Game of Thrones (season 4)|fourth season]] of the [[HBO]]'s critically acclaimed television series ''[[Game of Thrones]]''.{{Cite web |last=Wolff |first=Natasha |date=2014-04-02 |title=Pedro Pascal Joins Game of Thrones as the Red Viper and Had "Nerd Moments," Furious About Spoilers |url=https://dujour.com/culture/pedro-pascal-red-viper-game-of-thrones/ |access-date=2023-07-13 |website=DuJour |language=en-US |archive-date=July 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230713204031/https://dujour.com/culture/pedro-pascal-red-viper-game-of-thrones/ |url-status=live }} The season aired from April 6 to June 15, 2014, and Pascal's performance as the passionate and vengeful Prince of Dorne garnered significant praise from both critics and audiences.{{Cite web |title=Game of Thrones already lost its greatest hero: Why I loved Oberyn Martell |url=https://www.cnet.com/culture/entertainment/game-of-thrones-already-lost-its-greatest-hero-oberyn-martell/ |access-date=2023-07-13 |website=CNET |language=en |archive-date=July 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230713204031/https://www.cnet.com/culture/entertainment/game-of-thrones-already-lost-its-greatest-hero-oberyn-martell/ |url-status=live }} Pascal stated that he was a huge fan of ''Game of Thrones'' before being cast as Oberyn and was ecstatic to join.{{Cite web |last=Pedro_Pascal |date=2014-05-25 |title=I am actor Pedro Pascal. I play Oberyn in Game of Thrones, Ask me anything. |url=http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/26gtvt/i_am_actor_pedro_pascal_i_play_oberyn_in_game_of/ |access-date=2023-07-09 |website=r/IAmA |archive-date=July 20, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230720014550/https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/26gtvt/i_am_actor_pedro_pascal_i_play_oberyn_in_game_of/ |url-status=live }} As part of the ensemble, he has received a [[Screen Actors Guild Awards]] nomination for [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series|Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series]].{{Cite web |author=T. H. R. Staff |date=2015-01-24 |title=SAG Awards: Complete List of Winners |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/general-news/sag-awards-2015-winners-list-765943/ |access-date=2023-07-12 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |language=en-US |archive-date=January 25, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220125043436/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/general-news/sag-awards-2015-winners-list-765943/ |url-status=live }} In the 2015 movie, ''[[Bloodsucking Bastards]]'', Pascal portrayed the vampire Max.{{cite web |last1=Miska |first1=Brad |title=INDIE'Bloodsucking Bastards' Turns Cast Into Vamps |url=https://bloody-disgusting.com/indie/3289705/bloodsucking-bastards-turns-cast-into-vamps/ |date= April 21, 2014 |website=bloody-disgusting.com |access-date= June 7, 2017 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040442/https://bloody-disgusting.com/indie/3289705/bloodsucking-bastards-turns-cast-into-vamps/ |url-status=live}} In April 2015, Pascal co-starred with [[Heidi Klum]] in the music video for [[Sia]]'s "[[Fire Meet Gasoline]]".{{cite web |last1=Gordon |first1=Jeremy |title=Sia's "Fire Meet Gasoline" Used in Video Starring Heidi Klum, "Game of Thrones" Actor Pedro Pascal |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/59388-sias-fire-meet-gasoline-used-in-video-starring-heidi-klum-game-of-thrones-actor-pedro-pascal/ |website=[[Pitchfork Media]] |access-date= April 23, 2015 |date= April 23, 2015 |archive-date= December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229040539/https://pitchfork.com/news/59388-sias-fire-meet-gasoline-used-in-video-starring-heidi-klum-game-of-thrones-actor-pedro-pascal/ |url-status=live}} In August 2015, Pascal gained further recognition for his portrayal as [[Javier Peña]], based on a real-life [[Drug Enforcement Administration|DEA agent]], in the popular [[Netflix]] crime drama series ''[[Narcos]]''. The show's two first seasons depict the rise and fall of the infamous drug lord [[Pablo Escobar]] and the subsequent [[Medellín Cartel]].{{Cite web |last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |date=2014-06-06 |title=Pedro Pascal To Star In Netflix Drama Series 'Narcos' |url=https://deadline.com/2014/06/pedro-pascal-stars-narcos-netflix-741258/ |access-date=2023-07-12 |website=Deadline |language=en-US |archive-date=July 9, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230709205815/https://deadline.com/2014/06/pedro-pascal-stars-narcos-netflix-741258/ |url-status=live }} In 2017, as the show's focus shifted to the [[Cali Cartel]] for its [[Narcos (season 3)|third]] and final season, Pascal took on the role of both lead actor and narrator.{{Cite web |last=Strause |first=Jackie |date=2017-08-31 |title='Narcos' Star Pedro Pascal on Returning for a More "Insidious" Season 3 |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/narcos-season-3-pedro-pascal-interview-1033514/ |access-date=2023-07-12 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |language=en-US |archive-date=July 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230712215935/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/narcos-season-3-pedro-pascal-interview-1033514/ |url-status=live }} In 2017, he starred as Agent Whiskey in [[Matthew Vaughn]]'s ''[[Kingsman: The Golden Circle]]'' and as mercenary Pero Tovar in ''[[The Great Wall (film)|The Great Wall]],'' alongside [[Matt Damon]]''.''{{Cite web |last=Jaafar |first=Ali |date=2016-04-08 |title='Games Of Thrones' Pedro Pascal To Board 'Kingsman: The Golden Circle' |url=https://deadline.com/2016/04/games-of-thrones-pedro-pascal-kingsman-2-narcos-netflix-halle-berry-julianne-moore-matt-damon-great-wall-china-1201725794/ |access-date=2023-07-09 |website=Deadline |language=en-US |archive-date=December 10, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201210190801/https://deadline.com/2016/04/games-of-thrones-pedro-pascal-kingsman-2-narcos-netflix-halle-berry-julianne-moore-matt-damon-great-wall-china-1201725794/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |date= February 15, 2017 |title=Pedro Pascal goes from 'Game of Thrones' to 'Great Wall' He developed a close friendship with actress [[Sarah Paulson]] soon after moving there.{{cite web |url=https://www.interviewmagazine.com/culture/pedro-pascal |title=Pedro Pascal |author=Sarah Paulson |author-link=Sarah Paulson |date= September 18, 2014 |access-date= February 11, 2021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210116150127/https://www.interviewmagazine.com/culture/pedro-pascal |archive-date= January 16, 2021}} Pascal is an advocate of [[LGBT rights by country or territory|LGBTQ+ rights]]{{Cite web |last=Ennis |first=Dawn |title=This Is The Way 'The Mandalorian' Cast Gets Personal On Social Media |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/dawnstaceyennis/2020/10/30/this-is-the-way-the-mandalorian-cast-gets-personal-on-social-media/ |access-date= April 10, 2022 |website=Forbes |language=en |archive-date= April 11, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220411001948/https://www.forbes.com/sites/dawnstaceyennis/2020/10/30/this-is-the-way-the-mandalorian-cast-gets-personal-on-social-media/ |url-status=live }} and was supportive of his sister [[Lux Pascal]] when she came out as [[transgender]]. Lux said, "He has been an important part of this. He is also an artist and has been a guide.
